result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole J. Hindes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence Defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs and surcharges. If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

No Contact with Victim I.N., unless approved by the agent
Write a letter of apology to victim within 30 days, to be forwarded to agent first then forward on.
Complete a domestic abuse alternative program
Engage in any other assessments are recommended by the agent.
Comply with aftercare treatment being recommended if Defendant has already received substance abuse program. If not, attend AODA and comply.
Abstain from alcohol.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cole J. Hindes in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant Cole J. Hindes in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:37 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant is pleading to Count 1.
Counts 2-3 are being dismissed and read in.

Atty Kryshak concurs.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Kryshak for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

Victim is present.
Atty Kryshak acknowledges prior conviction(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. Court will adopt agreement.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 3 Years
Initial Confinement for 1 Year
Extended Supervision for 2 Years
Consecutive to any sentence Defendant is currently serving
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Not eligible for earned release program 
No pretrial incarceration credit
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
25% to be taken out of prison account
No Contact with Victim I.N., unless approved by the agent
Write a letter of apology to victim within 30 days, to be forwarded to agent first then forward on
Complete a domestic abuse alternative program
Engage in any other assessments are recommended by the agent
Comply with aftercare treatment being recommended if Defendant has already received substance abuse program. If not, attend AODA and comply
Abstain from alcohol
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ TTF 02/24/16

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Cole J. Hindes
Current: PO Box 3530, Oshkosh Correctional Inmate #558083, Oshkosh, WI 53903   (Effective: 10-23-2015)
Prior: 9608 Harding Rd, Plainfield, WI 54966

Attorney Erik John Mcfarland in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:42 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Cousins indicates the defendant has been revoked and is in prison but was not aware of that status to prepare a writ. 
Atty McFarland files motion to withdraw.  Makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Cousins indicates there is an agreement on this matter. 

BY THE COURT:  Court allows Atty McFarland to withdraw.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 11:15 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Cole J. Hindes in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Cole J. Hindes in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:02 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

2:11 p.m. Defendant Cole J. Hindes in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
No contact with Idalia Nunez, her residence, any residence she is occupying or her place of employment.

Defendant Cole J. Hindes appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant is vacated. 

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation. 
Defendant intends to hire an attorney.  If that does not work, he will get a public defender. 

Atty Cousins recommends a cash bond with conditions as stated. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will continue to allow for counsel.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
